retriever.engines.download_only module¶

class retriever.engines.download_only.engine[source]¶

Bases: retriever.lib.engine.Engine

Engine instance for writing data to a CSV file.

Attributes

db  
script  
table  

Methods

get_connection()[source]¶

Gets the db connection.

register_files(filenames)[source]¶

Identify a list of files to be moved by the download

When downloading archives with multiple files the engine needs to be informed of all of the file names so that it can move them.

retriever.engines.jsonengine module¶

Engine for writing data to a JSON file

class retriever.engines.jsonengine.engine[source]¶

Bases: retriever.lib.engine.Engine

Engine instance for writing data to a CSV file.

Attributes

db  
script  
table  

Methods

create_db()[source]¶

Override create_db since there is no database just a JSON file

create_table()[source]¶

Create the table by creating an empty json file

disconnect()[source]¶

Close out the JSON with a ] and close the file

Do to an extra comma after the last entry it is necessary to close the current file, read it back in, and remove the extra comma, before adding the closing bracket, and re-writing the file to disk. This will be inefficient for large files and we may want to replace it with something better.

execute(statement, commit=True)[source]¶

Write a line to the output file

format_insert_value(value, datatype)[source]¶

Formats a value for an insert statement

Overrides default behavior by: 1. Storing decimal numbers as floats rather than strings 2. Not escaping quotes (handled by the json module) 3. Replacing “null” with None which will convert to the ‘null’ keyword

in json
get_connection()[source]¶

Gets the db connection.

table_exists(dbname, tablename)[source]¶

Check to see if the data file currently exists

create_db()[source]¶

Creates the database

create_db_statement()[source]¶

In PostgreSQL, the equivalent of a SQL database is a schema.

create_table()[source]¶

PostgreSQL needs to commit operations individually.

In PostgreSQL, the equivalent of a SQL database is a schema.

Gets the db connection.

insert_data_from_file(filename)[source]¶

Use PostgreSQL’s “COPY FROM” statement to perform a bulk insert.
